(2) What distinguishes “move forward” vs. “pass”

• Show clear end-to-end ownership with measurable impact (what you did, what changed, by how much).
• Use structured problem-solving (strong assumptions, tradeoffs, and data-driven decisions).
• Communicate crisply in writing and align stakeholders without excess overhead.
Pass when candidates:
• Stay high-level (team did X) without specifics, metrics, or decision rationale.
• Struggle to articulate tradeoffs or how they’d validate an approach.
• Show limited collaboration signal or unclear role ownership.
